Transcription-Unit.comment: Putative promoter islands, which are regions of DNA containing multiple transcription start sites, were found by computational prediction methods in the intergenic region of the folD and sfmA genes in E. coli. These promoter islands are associated with genes acquired horizontally, and they are absent in the same region in Salmonella [Panyukov13]. In addition, some sites that bind HNS have been predicted in this intergenic region. This protein appears to inactivate the promoter islands [Panyukov13].

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.
